description:
Minor material amendment to planning consent ref. 66819/APP/2015/3653 dated 09-02-2016 for the Redevelopment of the site to provide a foodstore with ancillary cafe (Class A1) and ancillary petrol filling station, cinema (Class D2), 5 x restaurant units (Class A3), and residential development consisting of 132 units, together with new vehicle and pedestrian accesses, car parking, servicing areas, landscaping arrangements, and other associated works. 

The change seeks to amend the details secured by Condition 18 to alter the number of active and passive charging points.
decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the proposed reduction of electrical vehicle charging points would result in an unsustainable development which would compromise the shift from petrol and diesel vehicles to electric vehicles and fails to accord with Policy EM8 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 (2012) Local Plan: Part 2 Development Plan (2020) Policy DMT 6 Parking Standard (Appendix C - Table 1 (a) section 10), Policy DMEI 14 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 2 (2020), Policy SI 1 and T2 of the London Plan (2021) and paragraphs 174(e) and 186 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan 2021 and national guidance.

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).
